-----Original Message-----
From: R=
obert Watkins [mailto:robertw@...]
Sent: Wednesday, March 28, 2=
001 5:18 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] how to define =
testing criteria



Mike Choe wrote: 
> hi all. 
> how can you define your =
own testing criteria in JUnit? 
> i think there's a way and i thought i rea=
d about it somewhere but i'm 
> blanking out. 

It depends what you mean by=
 "testing criteria". 

You can extend the TestCase class to have additional=
 assert methods if
you want to routinely check on different things. For exa=
mple, I've got a
group of class doing a fair bit of work with reflection. I=
 ended up
defining a new test base class, and added a method like this:

pu=
blic void assertType(Class expectedType, Object o) { 
  assertNotNull("Can'=
t really check the type of a null object", 0); 
  assert("Expected type <" =
+ expectedType.toString() + ">. Actual Type:
<" + o.getClass().toString() +=
 ">", 
         o instanceof expectedType); 
} 

Is this the sort of thing =
you mean? 

Robert.
